page.title: 18CULWORTH FAMILY LIFE 1
page.content: There is very little organised activity for mothers,tiny children and babies in Culworth village.There is little need as families and members of the community support each other.Quite a few young mothers have relatives to call on for advice a short distance away.When the need has arisen groups of friends have joined together to form self help toddler groups.Baby sitting is undertaken by relatives,older members of the community and older teenagers.There is a playgroup run by mothers in the next village Eydon.There is a Northamptonshire County Council Nursery Unit at Woodford Halse School a few miles away.There is no longer a doctors surgery in Culworth but families registered with practices in Byfield,Banbury and Brackley enjoy the usual services.Access to private transport is important to get around.
